body:
Currently, it is possible to schedule a Temporal Workflow to run periodically, but the schedule needs to be specified by a cron Expression. This is restrictive. 

Also, it does not seem possible to specify initial delay. e.g. It does not seem possible to start a workflow 18 minutes from now, and then every 30 minutes after that.

It would be nice to have a [Java Scheduled Executor](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ScheduledExecutorService.html) like functionality for Temporal workflows with all of same options.

Specifically, a user should be able to specify 

1. Initial Delay for first execution of a periodic workflow
2. Time period for execution of a periodic workflow
3. Schedule with Fixed Delay / Fixed Rate
4. Schedule a workflow to run at a specified time only once.

comments.body:
This is now supported by the schedule feature: https://docs.temporal.io/workflows#schedule
You can set start time to limit your workflow to start only after start time.

title: Allow Java Scheduled Executor like options while specifying schedule of Workflows
